html:
2026-0016
2026-01-14INFCFinancial Administration ActOrder directing the Canada Infrastructure Bank, Canada Lands Company Limited, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, the Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc. and the Windsor-Detroit Bridge Authority to comply the “Buy Canadian” Procurement Policy Framework Order directing the Canada Infrastructure Bank, Canada Lands Company Limited, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, the Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc. and the Windsor-Detroit Bridge Authority to comply the “Buy Canadian” Procurement Policy Framework in order to (1) align their policies, guidelines, and practices with the “Buy Canadian Procurement Policy Framework” and the policy instruments issued under section 6 of that framework, as amended from time to time, in a manner consistent with their respective mandate, and ensure, if applicable and to the extent possible, that their wholly-owned subsidiaries and subsidiaries within the meaning of Part X of the Financial Administration Act do the same; and (2) report on the implementation of this directive in their next corporate plan.N/A
subject: Order directing the Canada Infrastructure Bank, Canada Lands Company Limited, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, the Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc. and the Windsor-Detroit Bridge Authority to comply the “Buy Canadian” Procurement Policy Framework
precis: Order directing the Canada Infrastructure Bank, Canada Lands Company Limited, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, the Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc. and the Windsor-Detroit Bridge Authority to comply the “Buy Canadian” Procurement Policy Framework in order to (1) align their policies, guidelines, and practices with the “Buy Canadian Procurement Policy Framework” and the policy instruments issued under section 6 of that framework, as amended from time to time, in a manner consistent with their respective mandate, and ensure, if applicable and to the extent possible, that their wholly-owned subsidiaries and subsidiaries within the meaning of Part X of the Financial Administration Act do the same; and (2) report on the implementation of this directive in their next corporate plan.
